label: Slack API
description: Arcade Wrapper Tools enabling LLMs to interact with low-level Slack API endpoints.

tools.name: AcceptSlackInvite
tools.description:
Accept invitations to a Slack Connect channel.

Use this tool to accept an invitation to a Slack Connect channel, facilitating seamless collaboration across different Slack workspaces.

parameters.name: channel_name
parameters.description: Provide the desired name for the Slack Connect channel. If the channel doesn't exist in your workspace, this name will be assigned to it.

parameters.name: invite_id
parameters.description: ID of the invitation you want to accept. Must provide either this or channel_id.

parameters.name: slack_channel_id_to_accept
parameters.description: The ID of the channel you would like to accept the invitation for. Either this or `invite_id` is required.

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: The ID of the workspace where the channel should be accepted. Required if using an org-level token.

parameters.name: is_channel_private
parameters.description: True to make the channel private; false to make it public.

parameters.name: use_free_trial
parameters.description: Set to 'True' to use your workspace's free trial to start using Slack Connect.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: AddCallParticipants
tools.description:
Add new participants to a Slack call.

This tool registers new participants to an existing call in Slack. It should be used when you want to add people to a call that is already in progress or scheduled. The tool ensures participants are correctly added using the appropriate Slack API scope.

parameters.name: call_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the call, as returned by the `calls.add` method. This ID specifies which call the participants will be added to.

parameters.name: participant_users
parameters.description: List of users to add, specified by `slack_id` or `external_id`. Include optional `display_name` and `avatar_url` for each user.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: AddSlackEmojiAlias
tools.description:
Add an emoji alias in a Slack Enterprise organization.

This tool calls the Slack API to add an alias for an emoji within a Slack Enterprise organization. It should be used when a user wants to create a new shortcut or name for an existing emoji. Requires appropriate admin permissions.

parameters.name: emoji_alias_name
parameters.description: The new alias for the specified emoji. Whitespace or colons will be automatically trimmed.

parameters.name: target_emoji_name
parameters.description: The name of the existing emoji to which the new alias is being added. Remove any surrounding whitespace or colons.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: AddSlackReaction
tools.description:
Add a reaction to a Slack item.

Use this tool to add an emoji reaction to a message or item within Slack. This can be useful for acknowledging messages or express sentiments quickly.

parameters.name: slack_channel_id
parameters.description: ID of the channel where the message is posted. Use to specify the location for adding a reaction.

parameters.name: reaction_emoji_name
parameters.description: The name of the emoji to be used as a reaction. Include skin tone modifiers if applicable (e.g., 'thumbsup::skin-tone-2').

parameters.name: message_timestamp
parameters.description: The timestamp of the message to which the reaction will be added. Ensure the format matches the Slack API requirements.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ApproveSlackChannelInvitation
tools.description:
Approve an invitation to a Slack Connect channel.

This tool is used to approve invitations sent to a Slack Connect channel, allowing collaboration between different Slack workspaces. It should be called when a user wants to manage and approve channel access invitations.

parameters.name: shared_channel_invite_id
parameters.description: The ID of the shared channel invitation you want to approve. It is required to specifically identify which invitation is being approved for the Slack Connect channel.

parameters.name: other_party_team_id
parameters.description: The team or enterprise ID of the other party involved in the Slack Connect invitation you are approving.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: CheckApiCallingCode
tools.description:
Verify the correctness of API calling code for Slack.

This tool verifies the accuracy and functionality of an API calling code by calling Slack's API testing endpoint. It's useful for developers who want to check if their code successfully interacts with Slack's API.

parameters.name: simulate_error_response
parameters.description: Specify an error code to simulate an error response for testing API calls. Useful for testing error handling.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: CheckSlackDiscoverability
tools.description:
Check if an email is discoverable on Slack.

Use this tool to determine if an email address is associated with a discoverable Slack user. It should be called when needing to verify Slack user discoverability by email.

parameters.name: email_to_check
parameters.description: The email address to verify if it is associated with a discoverable Slack user.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: CreateSlackConversation
tools.description:
Create a new public or private Slack conversation.

This tool is used to initiate a new conversation channel in Slack, allowing for the creation of either public or private channels. It is useful when setting up new communication threads within a team or project.

parameters.name: channel_name
parameters.description: The name of the new Slack channel to create. It must contain only lowercase letters, numbers, hyphens, and underscores, and be 80 characters or less.

parameters.name: encoded_team_id
parameters.description: The encoded team ID where the channel will be created. Required when using an organization-level token. Ignored if using a workspace-level token.

parameters.name: create_private_channel
parameters.description: Set to true to create a private channel instead of a public one.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: CreateSlackUserGroup
tools.description:
Creates a new user group in Slack.

This tool allows the creation of a new user group in Slack using the Slack API. It should be called when you need to organize users into groups for easier management or communication. Requires 'usergroups:write' scope.

parameters.name: user_group_name
parameters.description: A unique name for the user group to be created, distinguishing it from other user groups.

parameters.name: default_channel_ids
parameters.description: A list of channel IDs to set as default for the User Group. Use comma-separated values.

parameters.name: custom_additional_channels
parameters.description: Comma-separated encoded channel IDs where the User Group can add members.

parameters.name: user_group_description
parameters.description: A brief text describing the purpose or role of the user group in Slack.

parameters.name: unique_mention_handle
parameters.description: A unique mention handle for the user group. It must not duplicate existing handles of channels, users, or other user groups.

parameters.name: team_id_for_user_group_creation
parameters.description: Encoded team ID for the user group creation, required if using an org-level token.

parameters.name: include_user_count
parameters.description: Set to true to include the number of users in each User Group.

parameters.name: enable_display_as_sidebar_section
parameters.description: Set to true to display the user group as a sidebar section for all group members if the group has one or more default channels.

user_group_description.value: Group for all marketing department members.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: CustomUnfurlSlackUrls
tools.description:
Provide custom unfurl behavior for user-posted URLs on Slack.

This tool should be called to customize how URLs posted by users are displayed in Slack by providing a custom unfurl behavior.

parameters.name: channel_id
parameters.description: ID of the Slack channel where the message is posted. Required with 'ts' for custom unfurl or with 'unfurl_id' and 'source'.

parameters.name: message_timestamp
parameters.description: Timestamp of the message to which unfurl behavior will be added. Ensure it corresponds to a message in the specified channel containing a fully-qualified URL registered with your Slack app.

parameters.name: unfurl_url_map
parameters.description: A URL-encoded JSON map with URLs as keys and their corresponding unfurl data as values. Each URL should point to a single attachment, like message buttons.

parameters.name: authentication_invitation_message
parameters.description: A simple formatted string sent as an ephemeral message inviting the user to authenticate for full unfurl behavior. Supports Slack's *bold*, _italics_, and linking formatting. If provided, this takes precedence over `authentication_invitation_url`.

parameters.name: custom_authentication_url
parameters.description: A URL to redirect users for app authentication to enable full URL unfurling, requires URL encoding.

parameters.name: user_authentication_blocks
parameters.description: A URL-encoded JSON array of structured blocks to send as an ephemeral message for user authentication invitation.

parameters.name: unfurl_link_id
parameters.description: The ID of the link to unfurl. Must be used with 'source'.

parameters.name: link_source
parameters.description: Specify the source of the link to unfurl as either 'composer' for links inside the message composer or 'conversations_history' for links posted to a conversation. Must be used with 'unfurl_id', or alternatively with 'channel' and 'ts'.

parameters.name: require_user_authentication
parameters.description: Set to true if the user must install your Slack app to trigger unfurls for this domain.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DeleteScheduledSlackMessage
tools.description:
Delete a pending scheduled message from Slack queue.

Use this tool to remove a scheduled message from the Slack queue. It requires "chat:write" OAuth scope, allowing you to manage messages as an authenticated user or bot.

parameters.name: channel_id
parameters.description: The ID of the channel where the scheduled message is set to post. Required to identify the correct message to delete.

parameters.name: scheduled_message_id
parameters.description: The ID of the scheduled message to be deleted. This ID is obtained from the `chat.scheduleMessage` response.

parameters.name: delete_as_authenticated_user
parameters.description: Set to true to delete the message as the authenticated user with `chat:write:user` scope. Bot users are considered authenticated users. If false, the message will be deleted with `chat:write:bot` scope.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DenySharedInviteRequest
tools.description:
Denies an external user invitation to a Slack channel.

Use this tool to deny a request that invites an external user to join a Slack channel. It should be called when such an invite needs to be rejected.

parameters.name: shared_channel_invite_id
parameters.description: The ID for the shared channel invite request that you intend to deny. This is required for specifying which invite to decline.

parameters.name: deny_invite_message
parameters.description: An optional message explaining why the invitation was denied. This message will be sent to the requester.

deny_invite_message.value: We appreciate your interest, but we cannot allow external users at this time.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DisableUserGroup
tools.description:
Disable an existing Slack User Group.

This tool should be called to disable an existing User Group in Slack. It requires appropriate OAuth scopes and sends a POST request to the Slack API. Use this tool when you need to deactivate a User Group to prevent users from being able to reference or use it.

parameters.name: user_group_id
parameters.description: The encoded ID of the User Group to be disabled.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: Encoded target team ID where the user group exists. Required only if using an org-level token; ignored for workspace-level tokens.

parameters.name: include_user_count
parameters.description: Include the number of users in the User Group. Set to true to include the count.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: EditSlackBookmark
tools.description:
Edit an existing bookmark in a Slack channel.

This tool is used to edit an existing bookmark in a specified Slack channel. It requires appropriate permissions and should be called when you need to update the details of a bookmark in any channel you have access to.

parameters.name: slack_channel_id
parameters.description: The ID of the Slack channel where the bookmark will be updated.

parameters.name: target_bookmark_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the bookmark you want to update.

parameters.name: bookmark_title
parameters.description: The new title for the bookmark to update.

parameters.name: bookmark_link
parameters.description: URL of the bookmark to be edited. Ensure it is a valid format starting with http or https.

parameters.name: emoji_tag
parameters.description: The emoji tag to apply to the bookmark link. It should be a valid emoji code (e.g., :smile:).

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: EnableSlackFileSharing
tools.description:
Enable a Slack file for public sharing.

This tool enables a file for public or external sharing on Slack using the Slack API. It should be called when a user wants to share a file publicly outside their Slack workspace.

parameters.name: file_id_to_share
parameters.description: The ID of the file on Slack that you want to enable for public sharing.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: EnableSlackUserGroup
tools.description:
Enable a user group in Slack.

This tool activates a specified user group in Slack. It should be called when an action is needed to enable a user group so that it can be used within Slack for communication or organizational purposes. This tool is particularly useful for managing Slack user groups efficiently.

parameters.name: user_group_id
parameters.description: The encoded ID of the User Group to be enabled in Slack.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: Provide the encoded team ID where the user group is located. Only required if using an org-level token. Ignored with workspace-level tokens.

parameters.name: include_user_count
parameters.description: Set to true to include the number of users in the User Group.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: FetchWorkspaceSettingsInfo
tools.description:
Retrieve settings information for a Slack workspace.

This tool calls the Slack API to fetch detailed information about settings in a specific workspace. It is useful for administrators who need to manage team settings. The tool requires appropriate OAuth scopes for access.

parameters.name: slack_team_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the Slack workspace (team) for which to fetch the settings information.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: FindSlackUserByEmail
tools.description:
Find a Slack user using their email address.

This tool allows you to search for a Slack user by their email address. It should be called when you need to retrieve user information based on email within Slack.

parameters.name: user_email_address
parameters.description: The email address of the user in the Slack workspace to search for.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetCallInformation
tools.description:
Retrieve detailed information about a specific call in Slack.

Use this tool to access detailed information about a call within Slack by providing the call ID. Useful for obtaining call metadata such as participants, start time, and more.

parameters.name: call_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the call as returned by the `calls.add` method. This ID is necessary to retrieve detailed call information.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetConversationInfo
tools.description:
Fetches information about a Slack conversation.

This tool retrieves details about a specific conversation in Slack, such as its name, members, and other relevant data. It should be used when information about a Slack conversation is needed, and requires appropriate read permissions.

parameters.name: conversation_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the Slack conversation to retrieve information for.

parameters.name: include_locale
parameters.description: Set to `true` to receive the locale for this conversation. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: include_member_count
parameters.description: Set to true to include the member count for the specified conversation. Defaults to false.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetCurrentSlackTeamInfo
tools.description:
Retrieve information about the current Slack team.

This tool is used to get information about the current Slack team, including settings and general details. It is called when there's a need to access team information in a Slack workspace.

parameters.name: query_by_domain
parameters.description: Comma-separated domains to query instead of a team, used when the team is not specified. This only works for domains in the same enterprise as the querying team token.

parameters.name: specific_team_id
parameters.description: The ID of the Slack team to retrieve information about. If omitted, information about the current team will be returned.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetExternalFileUploadUrl
tools.description:
Retrieve a URL to upload an external file to Slack.

This tool is used to obtain a URL for uploading files externally to Slack, requiring the 'files:write' OAuth scope.

parameters.name: file_size_in_bytes
parameters.description: Specify the size of the file to be uploaded, measured in bytes. Ensure this value accurately reflects the file size.

parameters.name: file_name
parameters.description: The name of the file to be uploaded to Slack.

parameters.name: snippet_syntax_type
parameters.description: Specify the syntax highlighting type for the snippet being uploaded, such as 'javascript', 'python', etc.

parameters.name: alt_text_description
parameters.description: A description of the image for screen-readers, limited to 1000 characters.

alt_text_description.value: This is an example file used for demonstration purposes.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetIntegrationLogs
tools.description:
Retrieve integration logs for the current Slack team.

This tool retrieves the integration logs for the current Slack team, providing insights into the team's integration history and activities. It requires admin OAuth scope to access the logs.

parameters.name: filter_by_app_id
parameters.description: Filter integration logs to a specific Slack app. If not provided, logs for all apps are retrieved.

parameters.name: filter_by_change_type
parameters.description: Specify the change type to filter logs. Options: 'added', 'removed', 'enabled', 'disabled', 'updated'. Defaults to all logs.

parameters.name: result_count
parameters.description: The number of log entries to retrieve. Specify the maximum number of logs to return in a single request. (default: '100')

parameters.name: result_page_number
parameters.description: The specific page number of the integration logs to retrieve. Used for pagination. (default: '1')

parameters.name: filter_by_service_id
parameters.description: Specify the service ID to filter integration logs related to a specific service. If not provided, logs for all services will be retrieved.

parameters.name: encoded_team_id
parameters.description: The encoded team ID to get logs from, required if using an org-level token. Ignored if using a workspace-level token.

parameters.name: filter_by_user
parameters.description: Filter logs generated by a specific user's actions. Defaults to all logs if not specified.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetRemoteFileInfoSlack
tools.description:
Retrieve details about a remote file from Slack.

Use this tool to get information about a remote file that has been added to Slack. It is useful when you need details regarding the file, such as its metadata or status within Slack.

parameters.name: file_external_identifier
parameters.description: The GUID defined by the creator for the remote file to retrieve its information.

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the file to retrieve information about. Use this to specify the file in Slack.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetSlackBotInfo
tools.description:
Retrieve details about a Slack bot user.

This tool fetches information about a bot user in Slack. It should be called when details about a specific Slack bot are needed, such as its name, ID, or other metadata.

parameters.name: target_bot_id
parameters.description: The unique bot ID for which information is requested. This ID is specific to each workspace the bot is in.

parameters.name: team_id_for_org_token_use
parameters.description: Encoded team or enterprise ID where the bot exists. Required if using an organization token. Ignored if using a workspace-level token.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetSlackConversationMembers
tools.description:
Retrieve members from a specified Slack conversation.

Use this tool to get a list of members in a specific Slack conversation. This can apply to public and private channels, as well as direct and multi-party direct message conversations. Appropriate OAuth scopes are required to access different types of conversations.

parameters.name: conversation_id
parameters.description: The ID of the Slack conversation to retrieve members from. This can be a channel, group, or direct message.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: Cursor for pagination, set to the `next_cursor` value from a previous response to continue retrieving members from a conversation.

parameters.name: max_items_to_return
parameters.description: The maximum number of conversation members to return. Recommended to specify a value under 1000, with no more than 200 results at a time for optimal pagination. (default: '100')

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetSlackMessagePermalink
tools.description:
Retrieve a permalink URL for a specific Slack message.

This tool retrieves a permalink URL for an existing message in Slack. Use it when you need the direct link to a particular message in a Slack channel.

parameters.name: channel_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the Slack conversation or channel containing the message.

parameters.name: message_timestamp
parameters.description: The unique timestamp of the message to retrieve the permalink for. It identifies the message within the Slack channel.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetSlackRemoteFilesInfo
tools.description:
Retrieve information about remote files added to Slack.

This tool fetches details about remote files stored in Slack. It is useful when you need to access metadata for files that have been added to Slack from external sources.

parameters.name: filter_by_channel_id
parameters.description: Filter remote files to only include those appearing in the specified Slack channel, indicated by its channel ID.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: A cursor for paginating through data. Use the `next_cursor` from a prior request to fetch the next set of results. Defaults to the first page if not set.

parameters.name: maximum_items_to_return
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of remote file records to retrieve from Slack.

parameters.name: filter_files_from_timestamp
parameters.description: Filter files created after this inclusive timestamp. Use a Unix timestamp format. (default: '0')

parameters.name: timestamp_filter_end
parameters.description: Filter files created before this timestamp (inclusive) in Unix epoch time format. (default: 'now')

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetSlackTeamPreferences
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of a workspace's team preferences.

This tool fetches team preferences from a Slack workspace. It should be called when there's a need to access or review team settings. Requires appropriate OAuth scope for access.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetSlackThreadMessages
tools.description:
Retrieve messages from a Slack conversation thread.

This tool fetches a thread of messages posted to a specific conversation in Slack. It should be called when there is a need to review or analyze the message history of a public or private channel, a direct message, or a multi-party direct message. The tool requires appropriate OAuth scopes to access the message history.

parameters.name: conversation_id
parameters.description: The ID of the Slack conversation from which to fetch the message thread.

parameters.name: thread_message_timestamp
parameters.description: Unique identifier of a parent message or a thread message (timestamp). Fetches the thread or the single message.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: Cursor for pagination. Use the `next_cursor` from a previous response to fetch the next page of data.

parameters.name: latest_message_timestamp
parameters.description: Only include messages posted before this Unix timestamp in the results. (default: 'now')

parameters.name: maximum_items_to_return
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of messages to fetch. The default and maximum are 15 for certain apps, with possible rate limits. (default: '1000')

parameters.name: start_time_unix_timestamp
parameters.description: Only include messages after this Unix timestamp in results. (default: '0')

parameters.name: include_all_message_metadata
parameters.description: Set to true to return all metadata associated with this message.

parameters.name: include_boundary_timestamps
parameters.description: Include messages with 'oldest' or 'latest' timestamps. Ignored unless either timestamp is specified.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetSlackUserPresence
tools.description:
Retrieve user presence information from Slack.

Use this tool to get the presence status of a user on Slack, indicating whether they are active or away.

parameters.name: target_user_id
parameters.description: The Slack user ID for which you want to retrieve presence information. (default: 'authed user')

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetSlackUserProfile
tools.description:
Retrieve Slack user profile information and custom status.

This tool fetches the profile information of a Slack user, including their custom status and email (if authorized). It requires appropriate read scopes (users.profile:read or users:read.email).

parameters.name: target_user_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the Slack user whose profile information is to be retrieved.

parameters.name: include_labels
parameters.description: Include labels for each ID in custom profile fields. This option can heavily rate-limit requests and is not recommended. Default is false.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetTeamBillableUsersInfo
tools.description:
Retrieves billable users info for the current Slack team.

Use this tool to obtain information about billable users in your Slack team. It requires administrative privileges with the 'admin' scope.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: Cursor for pagination. Use the `next_cursor` from the previous response to fetch the next page of users. (default: 'fetches the first page')

parameters.name: maximum_items_to_return
parameters.description: Specifies the maximum number of billable user entries to be retrieved.

parameters.name: specific_user_id
parameters.description: The ID of a specific user to retrieve billable information for. Leave empty to retrieve info for all users.

parameters.name: encoded_team_id
parameters.description: Encoded team ID for retrieving billable info, required if using an org token. Ignored with workspace-level tokens.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetTeamProfile
tools.description:
Retrieve a team's profile information from Slack.

This tool retrieves a team's profile from Slack. It should be called when there's a need to access team information such as members, roles, or other relevant details. The tool uses the Slack API and requires the 'users.profile:read' OAuth scope.

parameters.name: visibility_filter
parameters.description: Filter the profile fields based on visibility. Options: 'all', 'visible', 'hidden'. Default is 'all'.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetUserIdentity
tools.description:
Retrieve a user's identity information from Slack.

This tool is used to get detailed information about a user's identity on Slack. It should be called when user identity details are required, such as for authentication purposes or to display user information within an application leveraging Slack's API.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: InviteUserToSlackChannel
tools.description:
Invite users to a Slack channel.

This tool sends an invitation to specified users to join a Slack channel. It should be called when you want to add new members to a channel via an invite.

parameters.name: slack_channel_id
parameters.description: The ID of the Slack channel to invite users to. It can be a public or private channel ID.

parameters.name: user_ids_list
parameters.description: A list of up to 100 user IDs to invite, separated by commas.

parameters.name: continue_with_valid_users
parameters.description: Set to true to invite valid users while ignoring invalid IDs when multiple user IDs are provided. Default is false.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: JoinSlackConversation
tools.description:
Join an existing conversation in Slack.

This tool is used to join a specified conversation within Slack. It requires appropriate user permissions and should be called when there's a need to participate in an existing Slack channel.

parameters.name: conversation_id
parameters.description: The ID of the conversation or channel you want to join in Slack.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ListAccessibleSlackConversations
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of conversations the user can access on Slack.

This tool calls the Slack API to list all conversations (public channels, private channels, direct messages) that a user has access to. It can be used to view information about different types of conversations including public channels, private channels, and direct or group messages.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: A cursor for pagination to continue listing conversations from a specific point. Use the 'next_cursor' from a previous response. Default is the first page.

parameters.name: maximum_items_to_return
parameters.description: The maximum number of conversations to return in the response. Must be an integer with a maximum value of 999. It is recommended to request no more than 200 results at a time for optimal performance. (default: '100')

parameters.name: slack_team_id
parameters.description: The encoded ID of the Slack team to list conversations for. Required if using an organization-level token. Ignored if a workspace-level token is used.

parameters.name: channel_types
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of channel types to filter conversations. Options: public_channel, private_channel, mpim, im. (default: 'public_channel')

parameters.name: specific_user_id
parameters.description: Filter conversations by a specific user ID's membership. Only includes conversations shared with the calling user.

parameters.name: exclude_archived_channels
parameters.description: Set to true to exclude archived channels from the retrieved list of Slack conversations. (default: false)

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ListApprovedWorkspaceInviteRequests
tools.description:
Retrieve all approved workspace invite requests from Slack.

This tool retrieves a list of all approved invite requests for a Slack workspace. It should be called when there is a need to review or manage approved invitations. The response will include details of each invitation request.

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: ID for the Slack workspace where the invite requests were made. Required if the Enterprise org has more than one workspace.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: Value of the `next_cursor` from the previous API response for paginating results.

parameters.name: result_limit
parameters.description: Specify the number of results to return, between 1 and 1000 inclusive. (default: '100')

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ListChannelsForUsergroup
tools.description:
Retrieve channels linked to an org-level user group in Slack.

Fetches a list of channels associated with a specified organizational IDP group in Slack. This tool is useful for admins managing user groups and their related channels.

parameters.name: usergroup_id
parameters.description: The ID of the IDP group to list channels for. It identifies which organizational group to retrieve the default channels from.

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the Slack workspace.

parameters.name: include_member_count_in_channels
parameters.description: Set to true to include the count of members for each channel, otherwise set to false.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ListCustomEmojiForTeam
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of custom emojis for a specific team.

Use this tool to get a list of custom emojis available for a team on Slack. It should be called when you need to display or manage team-specific emojis.

parameters.name: include_emoji_categories
parameters.description: Set to true to include categories for Unicode emojis in the response.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ListDeniedSlackInviteRequests
tools.description:
Retrieve denied Slack workspace invite requests.

This tool retrieves a list of all denied workspace invite requests on Slack. It should be called when there is a need to review or analyze denied invitations to a Slack workspace.

parameters.name: workspace_team_id
parameters.description: ID of the workspace where the invite requests were made. Required if the Enterprise org has multiple workspaces.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: The cursor value from the previous API response to fetch the next set of results. Use this for pagination.

parameters.name: result_limit
parameters.description: Specify the number of denied invite request results to return, between 1 and 1000 inclusive. (default: '100')

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ListPendingWorkspaceInvites
tools.description:
Retrieve all pending workspace invite requests from Slack.

Use this tool to list all pending workspace invite requests in a Slack workspace. This can be useful for administrators managing team invitations. Requires 'admin.invites:read' OAuth scope.

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: The ID of the workspace to list pending invite requests from. Required for multi-workspace enterprises.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: The cursor value for fetching the next set of invite requests. Use the `next_cursor` from the previous response if available.

parameters.name: result_limit
parameters.description: The number of invite requests to return per call, must be between 1 and 1000. (default: '100')

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ListPinnedItems
tools.description:
Retrieve items pinned to a Slack channel.

This tool calls the Slack API to list all items pinned to a specific channel. It should be used when there is a need to display or manage pinned items in a Slack channel.

parameters.name: channel_id
parameters.description: The ID of the Slack channel to retrieve pinned items from. This is required to specify which channel's pinned items will be listed.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ListScheduledMessages
tools.description:
Retrieve scheduled messages from Slack.

Use this tool to obtain a list of messages that are scheduled to be sent in a Slack workspace. It is useful for managing future communications and staying informed of pending messages.

parameters.name: channel_id
parameters.description: The ID of the Slack channel from which to retrieve scheduled messages.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: Cursor value for pagination to specify the starting point of the list from a previous call.

parameters.name: latest_timestamp
parameters.description: A Unix timestamp marking the latest point in the time range for fetching scheduled messages. Ensure it is greater than the `oldest` timestamp if both are set.

parameters.name: max_number_of_entries
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of scheduled messages to return from Slack.

parameters.name: oldest_timestamp
parameters.description: A Unix timestamp representing the start of the time range for scheduled messages. It must be less than the `latest_timestamp` if both are specified.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: Encoded team ID to specify which team's channels to list. Required if using an org-level token; ignore for workspace-level tokens.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ListSharedChannelInvites
tools.description:
Retrieve unapproved shared channel invites from Slack.

This tool retrieves a list of shared channel invites that have been generated or received but are not yet approved by all parties on Slack. It should be called when you need to manage or view pending shared channel invites.

parameters.name: workspace_team_id
parameters.description: The encoded team ID for the workspace to retrieve invites from. Required when using an organization token.

parameters.name: maximum_invites_to_return
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of unapproved shared channel invites to retrieve. (default: '100')

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: The cursor for paginating through results, obtained from a previous call's next_cursor.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ListSlackChannels
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of all channels in a Slack team.

This tool retrieves a list of all public and private channels that the user has access to within a Slack team. It can also view direct and multiparty direct messages, depending on the user's permissions.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: The cursor used to paginate through data collections. Use the `next_cursor` from a previous response to continue; omit for the first page.

parameters.name: maximum_number_of_channels
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of channels to return. Must be an integer under 1000. Note that fewer channels than requested may be returned. (default: '100')

parameters.name: team_id_for_org_app
parameters.description: Encoded team ID to list channels. Required for org-level tokens; ignored for workspace-level tokens.

parameters.name: channel_types
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of channel types to include, e.g., 'public_channel', 'private_channel', 'mpim', 'im'. (default: 'public_channel')

parameters.name: exclude_archived_channels
parameters.description: Set to true to exclude archived channels from the list of Slack channels. Default is false.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ListSlackEnterpriseEmojis
tools.description:
Retrieve emojis for a Slack Enterprise organization.

This tool uses the Slack Admin API to fetch a list of emojis available in a Slack Enterprise organization. It requires the appropriate OAuth scope to access team information.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: Cursor for fetching the next page of emojis. Use 'next_cursor' from the previous response.

parameters.name: max_items_to_return
parameters.description: The maximum number of emojis to return, between 1 and 1000 inclusive. (default: '100')

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ListSlackTeamUsers
tools.description:
Fetches a list of all users in a Slack team.

This tool retrieves a comprehensive list of all users within a specified Slack team. It includes user details and can access email information if the appropriate OAuth scopes are provided.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: Cursor for paginating through data. Use the `next_cursor` from a previous response to continue.

parameters.name: maximum_items_to_return
parameters.description: Maximum number of users to return (recommended max is 200 for pagination).

parameters.name: slack_team_id
parameters.description: The encoded team ID to list users from, necessary if an organization-level token is used. Ignored if a workspace-level token is provided.

parameters.name: include_user_locale
parameters.description: Set to true to receive locale information for each user. Default is false.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ListSlackUserGroups
tools.description:
Retrieve all user groups for a Slack team.

This tool retrieves a list of all user groups available in a Slack team. It should be called when there's a need to access or display user group information within a Slack workspace.

parameters.name: team_id_for_org_token
parameters.description: Encoded team ID required when using an org-level token. Ignored if using a workspace-level token.

parameters.name: include_user_count
parameters.description: Set to true to include the number of users in each User Group.

parameters.name: include_disabled_groups
parameters.description: Set to true to include disabled user groups in the results.

parameters.name: include_users_in_group
parameters.description: Include the list of users for each User Group in the response.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ListSlackWorkspaceOwners
tools.description:
Retrieve all owners in a Slack workspace.

This tool retrieves a list of all the owners in a specified Slack workspace, using the admin.teams.owners.list API endpoint. It is useful for managing or viewing the user roles within a Slack workspace.

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the Slack workspace for which to list the owners.

parameters.name: maximum_items_to_return
parameters.description: Specifies the maximum number of owners to return, ranging from 1 to 1000. (default: '100')

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: The cursor from the previous response used to fetch the next page of owners. Leave empty for the first page.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ListTeamsInEnterprise
tools.description:
Retrieve all teams in an Enterprise organization on Slack.

This tool retrieves a list of all teams within an Enterprise organization on Slack, utilizing the admin.teams.list endpoint. It should be called when information about the teams in an Enterprise organization is needed.

parameters.name: maximum_items_to_return
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of teams to retrieve. Must be a positive integer, up to 1000. (default: '100')

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: Use this to retrieve the next page of results by setting it to the `next_cursor` from the previous response.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ListWorkspaceUsers
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of users from a Slack workspace.

Use this tool to get a list of users in a specific Slack workspace. It's helpful for administrators who need to manage or view user information within the workspace.

parameters.name: workspace_team_id
parameters.description: The ID of the Slack workspace (e.g., T1234) to filter users from. Only users from this workspace will be listed.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: Use this to navigate through paginated results by setting it to the `next_cursor` from a previous response.

parameters.name: user_retrieval_limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of users to retrieve per page from the Slack workspace. (default: '100')

parameters.name: return_only_active_users
parameters.description: Return only active users if true; return only deactivated users if false. Default is true.

parameters.name: include_deactivated_user_workspaces
parameters.description: Include workspaces for users even if they are deactivated. Only applies with org token and no team_id. Default is false.

parameters.name: return_only_guest_users
parameters.description: If true, returns only guests and their expiration dates that belong to the specified team_id.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: OpenOrResumeSlackConversation
tools.description:
Open or resume a direct or multi-person message in Slack.

This tool calls the Slack API to open a new conversation or resume an existing direct message or multi-person direct message. It should be used when there's a need to start or continue a conversation within Slack.

parameters.name: conversation_channel_id
parameters.description: The ID of an existing direct or multi-person message channel to resume. Alternatively, provide the `users` field to start a new conversation.

parameters.name: target_user_ids
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of user IDs to open or resume a conversation. Provide 1 to 8 IDs. Supplying 1 ID opens a 1:1 DM, while more than 1 ID opens a multi-person DM. Do not include the caller's ID.

parameters.name: return_full_im_channel_definition
parameters.description: Set to true to receive the entire IM channel definition; false returns only the conversation ID.

parameters.name: prevent_creation
parameters.description: If true, does not create a new conversation and instead checks for an existing DM or MPDM.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: PinItemToSlackChannel
tools.description:
Pin an item to a Slack channel.

Use this tool to pin an item to a specific channel in Slack, enhancing visibility for important content.

parameters.name: channel_id
parameters.description: The ID of the Slack channel where the message will be pinned. A `timestamp` must also be provided.

parameters.name: message_timestamp
parameters.description: The timestamp (`ts`) of the message to pin in the Slack channel. Ensure the channel is also specified.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: RegisterSlackCall
tools.description:
Registers a new call on Slack.

This tool registers a new call on Slack using the Slack API. It should be called when you want to create and log a new call event in a Slack workspace. The tool requires appropriate permissions (calls:write scope).

parameters.name: unique_call_id
parameters.description: A unique ID for the Call, provided by the 3rd-party Call provider. Ensure it is unique across all calls from your service.

parameters.name: call_join_url
parameters.description: The URL required for a client to join the Call on Slack.

parameters.name: optional_human_readable_display_id
parameters.description: An optional, human-readable ID for the call, supplied by the third-party provider. This ID will be displayed in the Call object if given.

parameters.name: desktop_app_join_url
parameters.description: The URL used to directly launch the 3rd-party Call from Slack clients, if provided.

parameters.name: call_start_timestamp
parameters.description: Unix timestamp indicating when the call is scheduled to start.

parameters.name: call_title
parameters.description: The name of the Call to be registered on Slack. This title will be used to identify the Call within Slack.

parameters.name: call_creator_user_id
parameters.description: The valid Slack user ID of the creator of this call. Optional if using a user token, which defaults to the authed user.

parameters.name: participants_info
parameters.description: A list of participants to register for the call, including 'slack_id', 'external_id', 'display_name', and 'avatar_url' for each user.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: RemoveCallParticipants
tools.description:
Remove participants from a Slack call.

This tool removes specified participants from a call in Slack by registering their removal. Useful when a user needs to manage call attendees.

parameters.name: call_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the call from which participants are to be removed. This `id` is obtained from the `calls.add` method.

parameters.name: users_to_remove
parameters.description: A list of user IDs to remove as participants from the call. Refer to Slack's documentation for specifying user IDs.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: RemoveReactionFromItem
tools.description:
Remove a reaction from a Slack item.

Use this tool to remove a reaction (emoji) from a message, file, or file comment in Slack. This tool is intended for situations where a reaction needs to be revoked. It requires the 'reactions:write' scope, which allows the app to manage reactions on behalf of the user.

parameters.name: reaction_emoji_name
parameters.description: The name of the emoji reaction to be removed, such as 'smile' or 'thumbsup'.

parameters.name: target_file_id
parameters.description: The identifier of the file from which to remove the reaction. Specify either this, `target_file_comment_id`, or both `target_channel_id` and `target_message_timestamp`.

parameters.name: file_comment_id
parameters.description: The ID of the file comment from which you want to remove the reaction. Provide this if the reaction is on a file comment.

parameters.name: message_channel_id
parameters.description: Channel ID where the message to remove the reaction from was posted. Required if removing a reaction from a message. Use in combination with 'message_timestamp'.

parameters.name: message_timestamp
parameters.description: The exact timestamp of the message from which to remove the reaction. Specify when targeting a message.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: RemoveSlackBookmark
tools.description:
Remove a bookmark from a Slack channel.

This tool removes a specified bookmark from a Slack channel. It should be called when a user wants to delete a bookmark that is no longer needed or relevant. Requires appropriate permissions to execute.

parameters.name: slack_channel_id_to_remove_bookmark
parameters.description: The ID of the Slack channel from which the bookmark should be removed. This ID specifies the target channel and is required to locate and delete the bookmark.

parameters.name: bookmark_id_to_remove
parameters.description: The ID of the bookmark to be removed from a Slack channel. Ensure it is specified correctly to delete the correct bookmark.

parameters.name: quip_section_id
parameters.description: The ID of the Quip section to unbookmark. This is required to specify which section's bookmark should be removed.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: RenameSlackEmoji
tools.description:
Rename an emoji in a Slack Enterprise organization.

Use this tool to rename a custom emoji within a Slack Enterprise organization. It requires appropriate OAuth scope for team operations.

parameters.name: current_emoji_name
parameters.description: The current name of the emoji to be renamed. Colons (:myemoji:) around the value are optional.

parameters.name: new_emoji_name
parameters.description: The new name to assign to the emoji in the Slack Enterprise organization.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: RevokeSlackToken
tools.description:
Revoke a Slack authentication token.

This tool is used to revoke a Slack authentication token via a GET request to the Slack API endpoint. It should be called when it is necessary to invalidate a token to ensure it is no longer usable.

parameters.name: trigger_testing_mode
parameters.description: Set to true to trigger testing mode where the token will not be revoked. Useful for testing.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ScheduleSlackMessage
tools.description:
Schedule a message to be sent later in Slack.

This tool schedules a message to be sent to a specific Slack channel at a designated future time. It utilizes the Slack API endpoint 'chat.scheduleMessage' and requires the 'chat:write' OAuth scope.

parameters.name: slack_channel_id_or_name
parameters.description: Specify the target Slack channel, private group, or DM. Use an encoded ID or the channel name. Retrieve channel ID via `conversations.list`.

parameters.name: schedule_time_unix_timestamp
parameters.description: Unix timestamp for when the message should be posted to Slack. Must be within 120 days and not exceed 30 messages per 5-minute window.

parameters.name: attachments_json
parameters.description: A JSON array of structured attachments as a URL-encoded string for the Slack message.

parameters.name: structured_blocks_json
parameters.description: A URL-encoded string of a JSON-based array containing structured blocks for message formatting.

parameters.name: message_markdown
parameters.description: Message text in markdown format. Avoid using with 'blocks' or 'text'. Maximum 12,000 characters.

parameters.name: message_parsing_mode
parameters.description: Specifies how the message content should be parsed and interpreted when sending to Slack. For more details, refer to chat.postMessage documentation.

parameters.name: message_text
parameters.description: The main body of the Slack message or a fallback text when using blocks. Can be plain text or formatted with mrkdwn.

parameters.name: parent_message_timestamp
parameters.description: Timestamp of the parent message to which this message is a reply. Use the original message's timestamp, not a reply's timestamp.

parameters.name: metadata_json
parameters.description: JSON object containing 'event_type' and 'event_payload' fields. Must be URL-encoded. Note: using this will prevent scheduled messages from posting.

parameters.name: enable_group_linking
parameters.description: Set to true to link user groups in the message. Linking individual users is not supported; use mention syntax instead.

parameters.name: make_reply_visible_to_everyone
parameters.description: Set to true to make the reply visible to everyone in the channel or conversation. Use with `thread_ts`. Defaults to false.

parameters.name: enable_link_unfurling
parameters.description: Pass true to enable unfurling of primarily text-based content.

parameters.name: disable_unfurling_of_media_content
parameters.description: Set to true to disable unfurling of media content. Defaults to false.

message_text.value: Here is the main message body.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: SearchFilesInSlack
tools.description:
Search for files in Slack using a query.

This tool searches for files in Slack that match a given query. It is useful when a user needs to locate specific files shared in Slack channels or direct messages. The tool returns a list of files that meet the search criteria.

parameters.name: search_query
parameters.description: The text string to search for in Slack files. Use keywords or phrases to narrow down results.

parameters.name: items_per_page
parameters.description: The number of file results to return per page. Maximum allowed value is 100. (default: '20')

parameters.name: results_page_number
parameters.description: The specific page number of results to retrieve, with a maximum value of 100. (default: '1')

parameters.name: sort_files_by
parameters.description: Specify how to sort the search results: either by 'score' or 'timestamp'. (default: 'score')

parameters.name: sort_direction
parameters.description: Change the sort direction for search results to ascending ('asc') or descending ('desc'). (default: 'desc')

parameters.name: encoded_team_id
parameters.description: Encoded team ID to specify the search domain when using an org-level token. Ignored with a workspace-level token.

parameters.name: enable_query_highlight
parameters.description: Set to true to enable highlight markers for matching query terms in the search results.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: SearchSlackMessages
tools.description:
Search Slack messages based on a query.

This tool searches for messages in a Slack workspace that match a specified query. It should be called when users want to find specific messages or discussions within their Slack channels.

parameters.name: search_query
parameters.description: The text to search for in Slack messages. Use keywords or phrases to narrow down results.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: The number of search results to return per page, with a maximum limit of 100. (default: '20')

parameters.name: page_number
parameters.description: The page number of search results to retrieve, maximum value of 100. (default: '1')

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: Use '*' for the first call to start pagination or provide the 'next_cursor' value from previous results to continue.

parameters.name: sort_results_by
parameters.description: Specify the criterion for sorting the search results, either by 'score' for relevance or 'timestamp' for chronological order. (default: 'score')

parameters.name: sort_direction
parameters.description: Specify the order for sorting results: use 'asc' for ascending or 'desc' for descending. (default: 'desc')

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: The encoded team ID to search within. Required only if an organization-level token is used. Ignored for workspace-level tokens.

parameters.name: enable_query_highlighting
parameters.description: Set to true to enable query highlight markers, marking matching terms in the results.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: SendEphemeralMessageSlack
tools.description:
Send an ephemeral message to a user in a Slack channel.

This tool sends an ephemeral message to a user within a specified Slack channel. It's useful for sending temporary messages or notifications that only the specified user can see. Requires the 'chat:write' scope.

parameters.name: target_channel
parameters.description: The channel, private group, or IM channel where the ephemeral message will be sent. Accepts an encoded ID or the channel's name.

parameters.name: recipient_user_id
parameters.description: The ID of the user who will receive the ephemeral message. Must be in the specified channel.

parameters.name: structured_attachments
parameters.description: A JSON-encoded array of structured attachments for the message. Presented as a URL-encoded string.

parameters.name: structured_blocks
parameters.description: A URL-encoded JSON array of structured Slack block elements. Use for rich message formatting.

parameters.name: message_icon_emoji
parameters.description: Emoji to display as the message icon, overriding icon_url. Specify using the emoji name like :smile:.

parameters.name: message_icon_url
parameters.description: URL for the image to be used as the icon for the message. It overrides the icon_emoji if provided.

parameters.name: message_markdown_text
parameters.description: The main text formatted in markdown to be sent as an ephemeral message. Do not use with `blocks` or `text`. Character limit: 12,000.

parameters.name: message_parse_mode
parameters.description: Specifies how the message text is interpreted. Options are: 'none', 'full', 'mrkdwn', or 'false'. Defaults to 'none'. (default: 'none')

parameters.name: ephemeral_message_text
parameters.description: The main text of the ephemeral message for Slack. It acts as a fallback when using blocks; can be formatted as plain text or markdown. Limit to a few thousand bytes.

parameters.name: parent_message_timestamp
parameters.description: The timestamp of the parent message to post this ephemeral message in its thread. Ensure there is already an active thread.

parameters.name: bot_username
parameters.description: The username for the bot sending the ephemeral message. This sets the display name in the Slack message.

parameters.name: link_names_auto_link
parameters.description: Set to true to automatically find and link channel names and usernames.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: SendSlackMessage
tools.description:
Sends a message to a Slack channel.

This tool allows you to send messages to a Slack channel or direct message on behalf of an authenticated user. It is useful for automating communications within Slack workspaces.

parameters.name: target_channel_id_or_name
parameters.description: The encoded ID or name of the channel, private group, or IM where the message will be sent. Retrieve using Slack's conversations.list API.

parameters.name: message_attachments
parameters.description: A JSON array of structured attachment objects for the message, provided as a URL-encoded string. Example: `[{"pretext": "pre-hello", "text": "text-world"}]`.

parameters.name: structured_blocks
parameters.description: A JSON-based array of structured blocks for constructing messages using Block Kit. Provide as a URL-encoded string. Include fallback text if necessary.

parameters.name: emoji_icon_for_message
parameters.description: Emoji to display as the icon for the Slack message. Overrides any image URL icon.

parameters.name: message_icon_url
parameters.description: URL to an image to use as the icon for the message. Overrides any specified icon emoji.

parameters.name: message_markdown
parameters.description: The message text formatted using markdown, up to 12,000 characters. Cannot be used with `blocks` or `text`.

parameters.name: message_metadata
parameters.description: A JSON object with 'event_type' and 'event_payload' fields, URL-encoded, providing additional metadata for the message.

parameters.name: parse_mode
parameters.description: Specifies how the message content should be treated. Options are 'none' to remove hyperlinks or 'full' to ignore markdown formatting.

parameters.name: message_text
parameters.description: The main text of the message. Acts as the primary message or a fallback for notifications when using blocks. Supports plain text or markdown.

parameters.name: thread_timestamp
parameters.description: Timestamp of the parent message to which this message will be a reply. Use the parent's `ts` value, not a reply's.

parameters.name: bot_username
parameters.description: The display name to use for the bot when sending the message to Slack.

parameters.name: post_as_authenticated_user
parameters.description: Set to true to post the message as the authenticated user instead of as a bot. Only applicable for classic apps.

parameters.name: link_user_groups
parameters.description: Enable linking of user groups in the message. Individual user linking is not supported.

parameters.name: enable_slack_markup_parsing
parameters.description: Set to true to enable Slack markup parsing in the message. Default is enabled.

parameters.name: broadcast_reply_to_channel
parameters.description: Set to true to make the reply visible to everyone in the channel when responding to a thread. Use with 'thread_ts'. Default is false.

parameters.name: enable_unfurling_text_content
parameters.description: Set to true to enable unfurling of primarily text-based content in Slack messages.

parameters.name: disable_media_unfurling
parameters.description: Set to false to enable media unfurling and true to disable it. (default: 'false')

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: SetSlackChannelReadCursor
tools.description:
Update the read cursor in a Slack channel.

Use this tool to mark a specific point in a Slack channel as read. This is useful for keeping track of the latest read messages in channels, groups, or direct messages. Requires appropriate Slack OAuth scopes.

parameters.name: channel_id
parameters.description: The ID of the Slack channel or conversation where you want to set the read cursor. This should be a valid Slack channel ID.

parameters.name: timestamp_of_message_to_mark_as_read
parameters.description: The unique identifier (timestamp) of the message you want to mark as most recently seen in the conversation.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: SetSlackProfilePhoto
tools.description:
Set the user's profile photo on Slack.

Use this tool to update a user's profile photo on Slack. This requires the 'users.profile:write' OAuth scope, allowing changes to profile information including the profile photo.

parameters.name: crop_box_size
parameters.description: The size of the square crop box for the profile photo in pixels. Specify the width and height, which are the same value for a square.

parameters.name: crop_box_x_coordinate
parameters.description: X coordinate of the top-left corner of the crop box for the profile photo.

parameters.name: crop_y_coordinate
parameters.description: Y coordinate of the top-left corner of the crop box for the user's profile photo on Slack. This determines where the cropping of the image will start on the vertical axis.

parameters.name: profile_photo_image
parameters.description: The image file to set as the Slack profile photo. Provide image data directly with the correct content type (e.g., image/jpeg, image/png).

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: SetSlackWorkspaceName
tools.description:
Update the name of a Slack workspace.

Use this tool to update the name of a specified Slack workspace. This tool should be called when there's a need to change the workspace name. It requires appropriate permissions.

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the Slack workspace whose name you want to update.

parameters.name: new_workspace_name
parameters.description: The desired new name for the Slack workspace. This replaces the existing name.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: SetWorkspaceDescription
tools.description:
Update the description of a Slack workspace.

This tool updates the description of a specified workspace in Slack. It requires admin permissions with the 'admin.teams:write' scope. It should be called when there is a need to change or set a new description for a Slack team.

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the Slack workspace where the description will be updated.

parameters.name: workspace_description
parameters.description: The new description to set for the Slack workspace. Provide a clear and concise text.

workspace_description.value: A collaborative workspace for the marketing team.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ShareRemoteFileInChannel
tools.description:
Share a remote file into a Slack channel.

This tool shares a specified remote file into a selected Slack channel. It utilizes Slack's API to facilitate file sharing across channels.

parameters.name: target_channel_ids
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of Slack channel IDs where the remote file will be shared. Ensure IDs are valid and the user has permission to share files in these channels.

parameters.name: file_external_identifier
parameters.description: The globally unique identifier (GUID) for the file set by the app when registering with Slack. Required if 'file' is not provided.

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description: The ID of a file registered with Slack to be shared. Required if `external_id` is not provided.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: UpdateSlackUserGroup
tools.description:
Update an existing User Group in Slack.

This tool updates an existing User Group in Slack. It should be called when you need to modify the details of a user group, such as its name or permissions. Ensure the appropriate permissions are granted with the 'usergroups:write' scope.

parameters.name: user_group_id
parameters.description: The encoded ID of the User Group to update in Slack.

parameters.name: default_channel_ids
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of channel IDs where the User Group is set as default. Use encoded channel IDs.

parameters.name: additional_channel_ids
parameters.description: Comma separated encoded channel IDs for custom additions to user group members.

parameters.name: user_group_description
parameters.description: A short description of the User Group to update in Slack. This should clearly define the group's purpose or role.

parameters.name: user_group_handle
parameters.description: Unique mention handle for the User Group, distinct from all channels, users, and other User Groups.

parameters.name: user_group_name
parameters.description: A unique name for the User Group to update. Ensure it does not duplicate any existing User Group names.

parameters.name: team_id_for_org_token
parameters.description: Encoded team ID where the user group exists, required for org-level tokens. Ignored if using a workspace-level token.

parameters.name: include_user_count
parameters.description: Set to true to include the number of users in the User Group.

parameters.name: enable_sidebar_section
parameters.description: Set to true to configure the user group to appear as a sidebar section for all group members. Only relevant if the group has 1 or more default channels.

user_group_description.value: This group is for project managers.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: UpdateSlackUsergroupUsers
tools.description:
Update the list of users in a Slack user group.

This tool updates the list of users for a specified Slack user group. It should be called when changes to the membership of a Slack user group are required.

parameters.name: user_group_id
parameters.description: The encoded ID of the Slack user group to update.

parameters.name: user_ids_list
parameters.description: A comma separated string of encoded Slack user IDs representing the complete user list for the group. This replaces all current members.

parameters.name: team_id_for_org_token
parameters.description: Encoded team ID where the user group exists. Required if using an organization token; ignored with workspace-level token.

parameters.name: update_additional_channels
parameters.description: Encoded channel IDs to add user group members to, separated by commas. These represent additional channels for custom user group member additions.

parameters.name: include_user_count
parameters.description: Set to true to include the number of users in the user group in the response.

parameters.name: is_shared_section
parameters.description: Indicates if the API call involves a shared section. Set to true if it does, otherwise false.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

summary:
The Arcade Toolkit for SlackApi provides a comprehensive interface for interacting with Slack's low-level API endpoints. Developers can utilize this toolkit to automate and enhance various administrative and communication tasks within Slack.

**Capabilities:**
- Create and manage conversations, channels, and user groups.
- Handle messaging actions including sending, scheduling, and deleting messages.
- Manage user presence and profiles.
- Facilitate collaboration through call management and participant administration.
- Perform advanced search operations on messages and files.

**OAuth:**  
Provider: Slack  
Scopes: admin, admin.invites:read, admin.teams:read, chat:write, users:read, and several others.

**Secrets:**  
No secrets are required for this toolkit.
